body:
Correction; I do have a simple repository as a reproducer: https://github.com/strictify/forms-playground/tree/psalm-reproducer

Problematic version 3.15:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1964158/92303351-3012ba80-ef74-11ea-965a-3363ea29090a.png)

---

Version 3.14.2 correctly knows $user will be instance of ``?User``:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1964158/92303371-6e0fde80-ef74-11ea-93f8-2dbb61605ce4.png)

(I put trace to be on error level)

---

I added changes in code for this reproducer, it can be downloaded.

@muglug I just tested it and while it doesn't throw errors anymore, PresetDataEvent doesn't register correct data (like 3.14.2 did).

To remove variables from reproducer, I uninstalled Symfony plugin and added stubs [in repository itself](https://github.com/strictify/forms-playground/tree/psalm-reproducer/stubs).

---

So in 3.14.2:

```
ERROR: Trace - src/Controller/Users/Complex/Form/SimpleUserType.php:43:0 - $user: App\Entity\User|null 
```

changing psalm to dev-master:

```
ERROR: Trace - src/Controller/Users/Complex/Form/SimpleUserType.php:43:0 - $user: mixed 
```

Thank you @muglug , I wasn't sure if you read github email and planned to create new issue in few days.

I just tested, works perfectly!

issue.title: [FrameworkBundle] Add AbstractController::handleForm() helper
